description: ***** keeping writing super
The app is great for many purposes,but for some reason the equalizer doesn't work.(Don't know Particularly in my system).

Every single start up of the system, i have to manually open pulseeffects and turn off and on compression for it to work, i am using the flatpak version, people said that the flatpak doesnt have that problem but it unfortunately does have it.

The application is set to open on startup and i can see it in the system startup settings, but it still doesnt open.
summary: not bad but the start up bug is still there

description:
Can anyone help to get the ON/OFF slider in the MIC section. I re-installed the software multiple times but it seems that it is still not working. 
So far this is the best software that I have come across. And it will be really helpful if the developers can provide some solution to this.
Good Control and the details of audio conversion are specially helpfull.

I have already tried all the windows, mac and now linux equalizers and I can assure you that this software is the BEST EQ IN THE WORLD (system eq). With the ability to manipulate 30 frequency bands before the sound is output to your speakers. Spotify playing while Pulse Effects running in the background takes the music experience to an all new level. AMAZING! I cannot thank you enough for giving away this master piece.

Great and very extensive, easy to pick up atleats the part where you click "equalizer" and start equalizing. I didn't find any option to save multiple presets. Also when scrolling from frequency to frequency ie. 100Hz to 10.000Hz the sidescroll slider overlaps my decibel marks which I would like to see when scrolling sideways in the app. Great app overall, highly recommended!
summary: For a beginner great yet missing some preset saving features (AFAIK)

description:
It has a lot of settings and variation. Some subtle some very obvious. 

The only downside is that after a Linux (Kubuntu) restart the settings are not used even when the service is started at the logon (ticked setting). I have to manually start Pulse Effects and turn the EQ off and on again for the settings to actually work.
very good equalizer

After trying for a long time using terminal, I got it installed in one shot.
Great and useful, especially for bringing it on the app store.
This goes far beyond EQ. Now my system sounds as I want.
It was a bit complicated at first but finally getting the app setup makes it worth while. All of my audio devices work and you can push the boundries of your speakers, headphones etc.

I use tribit stormbox pro bluetooth speakers on my laptop. The bass level is a bit much on some tracks, so I looked for an eq. Most reviews recommended this application. You can adjust every parameters. The multiband equalizer can really refine the sound. I am still exploring all the features; but at the moment, I am very impressed.
Great job, good sound now
Recommended tool for equalizer and much more
I've been searching for good equalizer for Linux for a while and PulseEffects totally blew me away with its capabilities, way beyond my expectations.
The variety of effects makes it possible to adjust music to fit my loss of higher frequency hearing. It's great!

works as you would expect, you can suddenly make your audio so much better(or worse if you have no clue what you are doing)

my only issue with it, is that i cannot start it as at login, i have to start it manually. however after that i can close it just fine and let it run in the background.

also a gnome tray indicator would be nice, or some other way to get it to show other than launching it again.

keep up the good work, love how i can get me laptop speakers to sound this great, and overall make audio much better.
This looks the kind of thing I was looking for, and more. Just started using it - the bass enhancement works pretty well. Now to jump in and explore it.
Great program , install you wont be disappointed.
summary: One of the best if not the best

description: Improves sound quality if you know what you are doing. There was a little bug on first try, but after changing sound profile on KDE settings it worked well.

almost nothing works. nice gui, but does nothing. requires all kinds of libs, that enable the application to do nothing.

great for adding latency to audio, in case you need latency added to audio.
summary: nothing works, great for adding latency to audio though!

description:
I'm a weirdo who likes listening to music in different keys, so the Pitch plugin is great for me. Wish it used a higher quality pitch-shifter like the one found in Soundtouch, but Rubberband does the job decently enough too.

If you need an EQ or any effects for your microphone or outputs, you can't go wrong with PulseEffects. Make sure you install the plugins first - Fedora pulls them all as dependencies.
lots of lag
Works very nice!
I use equalizer and bass booster, works fine.
Best ever I have been seen
Used to like it a lot. Now it fails to launch and cuts my audio and prevents anything to work.
summary: Used to be great, now tanks my audio

description: love the app! wish there was a way to make it hide in the app indicators or background better

This app adds what i missed for long time

What dont work for me?
* Dark theme (gnome with extensions)
* Real-time processing

This is a vital part of my OS but it breaks constantly on 18.04 (goes silent, leaves multiple ghost processes in the system monitor and shows AudioIPC server as null when it's fine). Fixed by uninstalling the store version and switching to the PPA.

https://github.com/wwmm/pulseeffects/wiki/Package-Repositories#debian--ubuntu
summary: Fantastic app (if you use the PPA, not store build.)

description: Simple enough most people can use, as long as you ignore everything except equalizer. Full featured enough to impress any audiophile. The best system wide sound enhancer I have seen.

I highly recommend this application to anyone who wants to take control of the input and output of your audio devices! This application has made it able to improve the way I experience music/audio from my headphones and speakers.
Installed this app on my Pop-OS desktop
summary: Love that this app is now on flathub

description: With Ubunto 19.10, the audio does not work have the time and when it does it's laggy. Just using for EQ so I've switched to a Chrome plugin instead.

Ubuntu 19.10 - Inspiron 560 - Pithos
The system froze after this app was started while Pithos was playing Pandora. Bump...
wanted to get it for system wide equalizer and installed it from ubuntu software directly but the equalizer function was greyed out.

Very good audio effects.
To bad it doesn't have a manual for explanation.
the problem on linux doesnt have adolby home theater v4 or digital plus like windows and no any sound enhancement on linux put now i have this best amazing app thank you developers

Started playing around with it. Got bass boost to work. But then i made the mistake of trying to make the sound louder. I touched the firefox app in the app list, and now the sound rocker in my start menu thing doesnt do anything now. It seems to be affecting "pulseeffects(mic)" now. 

Wierd.
from my point this app is good one. handle like a charm. love it good sound manager.
summary: for those who thinks linux lacks a good sound manager this is it

description: Took me a long time to find something that allowed EQ adjustment on Linux, but this does the trick. Works great, tons of functionality.
I know write check IT!
It is greyed out
summary: How do I make Equalizer enableable?

description:
That you need to GUESS the correct file extension for impulse files. Yeah it's super obvious how you need to rename your files to be seen as "Impulse Response". And why .wav is not accepted if the actual file format is the same is beyond me, too. 
Guess I need to go read the docs again... LOL
Everything works *except* the equaliser. Very disappointing.

dell xps 15
It works absolutely fine for me. The best app I have installed on my pc, I recommend to enable the dolby atmos preset
While there are a lot of nice things in this application, it's all pointless for me because the app won't allow me to turn on the EQ which is the entire point of me downloading this.
The best app to enhance the output sound I've ever used!
It worked until the first reboot, after that, nothing works

If configured properly, no one need dolby atmos or DTS surround. You can get all the effects in one application. Mind blowing experience. Download only from flathub not from snap store. Because in ubuntu 19.10 "equalizer" option for pulseeffects is disabled, but if you download it from flathub, you can get it enabled. Go to flatpak website and follow the instructions.

I was using the app when watching Netflix streaming movies in Vivaldi browser or Firefox browser on Lubuntu 18.04. It is a great app when it works - 4 stars. App stopped outputting sound on or around March 9, 2020. I can't get it to work. Uninstalling.
Useful and very complete!
¿What can I do?
summary: Good app, but I can't turn on the equalizer tab

description: how to enable eq

Lots of options, great customization. 
Includes equalizer presets for basic users and professional settings for advanced users
The best thing you could ask for! Thank you!!!
For anyone having to listen to recordings or videoconferencing when the speaker isn't properly distanced from their mic this is a lifesaver!
summary: Excellent for removing high frequencies from microphones

description:
Really a piece of art.
You can enhance/distort your audio output to your heart's content.
Except: Compressor, Convolver, Equalizer appear disabled.
Pitch crashes without a trace. What a shame, Not even unit testing...

Fix these for 5 stars upgrade...
4/5 as a first impression. This is really good.
summary: Where has this been all my life?

description: working perfectly
It's an amazing equalizer!
Slow and hang up frequently Ubuntu 18.04
Equalizer dosnt work on Ubuntu 20
Fixed sound-less hp envy side speakers by raising side speaker volume to 10
summary: It got my side speakers working!

description: That is exactly what I was looking for so long. And working like charm. Feature Rich .
i really like this app, i was searching for an equalizer and i got this
Tried few other equilizers but pulse is best among them.
Has nice features, but it's a massive CPU performance hog. I'm seeing 70%+ CPU utilization.
summary: Has nice features, but a massive CPU performance hog

description:
I am impressed by how "bass enhancer" and "exciter" make hip hop sound wow?.
Pulseeffects consume about 30% of my cpu(intel celeron n3060) which is very high?
Its a very good app, but I dont recommend using it.
summary: New update totally janked my computer

description: Works like a charm, so much powerful EQ. I didn't expect that much when I installed the app!

The software is just fantastic. I wanted the equaliser as my headphones have a very skewed operating curve. Worked very well. In terms of the application, I have absolutely no gripes. Top notch! 

The only reason I would not use it is if I find a similar software which actually is native to gnome and uses GTK properly instead of imposing a fake apple-like feel. The GUI in GTK (gnome3) is quite ugly. It is not intuitive at all and seems to follow a very outdated aesthetic. I think it should just allow GTK to do the window decorations instead.
summary: Fantastic software! UI not very GTK friendly

description: new version doesn't seem to work
summary: new version doesn't seem to work

description: It does go out sometime, but I changed the priority of the daemon to high and the niceness level in preferences. The audio works flawlessly once you set it up properly. I cannot thank you enough to include the reverberation option.
The app doesn't launch in 18.04 but managed to mangle my audio nonetheless. Uninstalling now.
Really needed this, must have for all ubuntu OS
For all plugins (Including Equalizer) to be usable 'sudo apt install lsp-plugins -y' must be used.

I previously used the PulseEffects Equalizer to greatly improve the sound quality from my otherwise-boomy Altec Lansing speakers.
When installed in Ubuntu 20.04.01, PulseEffect's features were greyed-out and inaccessible until I found a way to install missing components.
Now I get no sound at all, and the PulseEffects user interface crashes about two seconds after I start it.
I will uninstall PulseEffects and wait for a new version :(
summary: Great features, but currently not working

description: This application is one of the reasons I use linux. Congratulations to the developers.
You have full control over the output. Good job community.

It works flawlessly. It actually made my crappy speakers on my laptop sound so good, but once installed (on gnome), the app drawer gets filled with "apps". Literally over 50 "apps" are there. I know they are not apps, they look like the configuration files (or may be the sound profiles/presets or something), but they show up in the app drawer. Why? why clutter the app drawer with that many "apps"? Why not have them all in a file somewhere in whatever directory this app is located. Other than that, it is an amazing app. I can't use it until this is fixed sadly. :/
Laggy and provides too much system load.
equalizer don't work, can't enable it.
Улучшает звук, делает насыщеннее. Мощная программа , надо только немного в настройках поначалу разобраться . Благодарю разработчиков .

When I first installed Fedora (several issues), it worked just fine. Now, many of the options are greyed out. Ive scoured the net and installed what I thought were all the missing libraries to no avail.
i love it cause it works when you're using a music app, but while streaming music through websites on a browser, most of the features don't work. why's that???
Works great on Ubuntu 20.04
super tool for enhance audio.
rebot system, strat PE, all ok. Start chrome, all ok. start palying video on yourube for example and after 1-2 seconds PE crashes
This is a great app but the equalizer feature appears to be disabled in Ubuntu 20.04.1. Not sure how to fix it. Works fine on Linux Mint.
gnome menu is fuc**d by hundreds of pulseeffect plugin.
Messes up Ubuntu 20.04 when trying to install, caused a run 'dpkg --configure -a' error

there are many similar programs for win but very poor choice for Ubuntu. This is what you need. There are many presets, a lot of options and ability to fine-tune. It worked immediately. It is easy to use.
summary: Just what I was looking for long time for Ubuntu

description: Works perfectly as what I needed

description:
Just do sudo apt install -y lsp-plugins

Thank you!
I use the ppa so it would install all the recommend dependencies
you can manage the output and many effect is provided, should be listed for you

Man, my biggest problem was solved that is to downmix 5.1 audio to stereo while watching amazon prime videos. This kind of software would be priced very high generally but I can't belive that it is free on Linux. Must download app.
summary: Great app. I recomend it to all

description:
It is a very usefull app. There are more ways to enhance your audio than you will need, the gui is really good, everything is costumizable and the choice is yours and yours alone what you do and how to do it.

Unfortunatly, the app is a little laggy and sometimes doesn't start at all or corrupts the pipeline and you have to pulseaudio -k to get any sound at all again.
summary: Very Good App - stability needs work

description: Eine Ausführliche Einstellanleitung in Deutsch wäre ganz hilfreich
pefeckt leistung auch sehr gut
Installiert und funktioniert sofort perfekt. Super Klang Anpassung!

I use PulseEffects since half a year now and it never disappointed me. It runs very stable on Fedora 32 and offers great options to enhance your audio quailty. For example, my headset has very little bass by default but with PulseEffects I was able to get that good bass back. In my eyes a must have application!
In the past I rarely had a good experience with audio on linux, so I was a bit skeptical. But this tool works. Thanks a lot to the developers!

Super endlich kann ich die Atmospähre auf den Sound anwenden den ich höre.
Ich kann fein abstimmen wie ich es mag. Das hat mir schon lange gefehlt. 
Top Arbeit. Danke
summary: Grossartiges Tool hanbe lange nach so was gesucht

description: seit dem heutigen Ubuntu Update, stürzt Pulseffects wenn ein Browser wie Firefox geöffnet ist und ein youtube Video etc. abspielen soll ab. Nicht nur dass, sondern im Firefox Browser ist auch kein Sound mehr zu hören, wenn Pulseffects deinstalliert wird, funktioniert der Ton im Firefox wieder. Bis gestern ging alles, seit dem Ubuntu Update heute nicht mehr!
cool sehr gut
Lo instalo más que nada para usar Cantata con ecualizador, pero funciona también don Firefox o Kodi. Merece la pena tenerlo instalado para mejorar el audio de cualquier software.
summary: Va muy bien y funciona en todo el sistema operativo

description: realmente en la ultima version de Ubunto 20 04 lts, aparentemente funciona, pero al hacer alguna configuracion de audio o ecualizacion, no causa ningun efecto, todo sigue sonando normal.

Lo vania usando en ubuntu 20.04 sin problemas, al instalarlo en ubuntu 22.04 la reducción de ruido (que es lo único que me interesaba) ha dejado de funcionar. Además no se puede desinstalar a través de Ubuntu Software.
Excelente complemento para pulseaudio, agregando a este equalizacion y diversos efectos en tiempo real a tu gusto, mejorando la experiencia sonora significativamente en linux.

Je n'ai jamais trouvé un équivalent aussi riche en fonctionalités pour améliorer le son en temps réel. Rien que le compresseur m'évite de passer du temps à régler le niveau sonore qui serait trop faible ou trop fort. Non vraiment, c'est une pétite qui devrait être connue davantage, bravo aux développeurs !

Огромный респект создателям! Это шикарный звукопроцессор)))

всем советую программу
Кроме самой программы было получено куча всякого профессионального ненужного шлак в количестве "хер знает сколько штук" - очень много. Это дебиан-стабле. Флетхаб - норм.
